document.masterDocTitle: Description of a new fireworm, Eurythoe turcica sp. nov. (Polychaeta: Amphinomidae), from the Levantine coast of Turkey (eastern Mediterranean), with re-descriptions of Eurythoe parvecarunculata Horst and Amphinome djiboutiensis Gravier based on type material

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of a new fireworm, Eurythoe turcica sp. nov. (Polychaeta: Amphinomidae), from the Levantine coast of Turkey (eastern Mediterranean), with re-descriptions of Eurythoe parvecarunculata Horst and Amphinome djiboutiensis Gravier based on type material

bibRefCitation.author: Horst R
bibRefCitation.refString: Horst R. 1912. Polychaeta errantia of the Siboga Expedition. Part 1, Amphinomidae. Siboga Exp Utk zool bot oceanog geol Geb verz Neder Oost Indie 1899 - 1900 aan Boord HM Siboga ond Comm van Luit GF Tydeman. 24 (1 a): 1 - 43.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Eurythoe parvecarunculata Horst 1912 : p.37
, Plate X, Figures 1–5 ; Fauvel 1953 : p.85, Figure 38e–I; Day 1967 : p.128, Figure 3.2 i–l.
Holotype , ZMA-V.Pol. 0309, Siboga Expedition, station 312, Indian Ocean, Saleh Bay, north coast of Sumbawa, 274 m depth.

Holotype complete, 16 mm long, 1.4 mm wide, with 50 chaetigers ( Figure 6A ). Body elongated, almost rectangular in cross-section; segments gradually becoming enlarged towards median region and then gradually shortened towards posterior end; dark brownish, without colour markings.

All parapodia biramous with a dorsal and ventral cirrus. Cirri with distinct, irregular annulations; dorsal cirri slender tapering; ventral cirri digitiform; dorsal cirri longer than ventral one on all chaetigers. Ventral cirri emerging on ventral part of chaetal fascicles; dorsal cirri emerging on posterior part of chaetal fascicles; associated with chaetal lobes. All parapodia with blunt chaetal lobes; dorsal lobe larger, conical in anterior segments. Posterior segments with chaetal lobes reduced to small protuberances.

Branchiae present from chaetiger 3 to end of body, dendritically branched throughout, except last three chaetigers where branchiae with only one filament. Anterior branchiae well developed, with about 50 terminal filaments, reduced to one to three filaments on posterior chaetigers; filaments densely ciliated.

Notopodia of chaetiger 1 with seven furcate chaetae, 25 serrated capillaries with a minute basal spur and 12 serrated capillaries with a long basal spur. Long tine of furcate chaeta with fine spines on cutting edge, 63 mm long; short tine 10 mm long; Blade (distance between basal spur and tip) of serrated capillary with a long basal spur 300 mm long; spur 18 mm long. Blade of serrated capillaries with a minute basal spur 400 mm long ( Figure 6H ). Majority of chaetae on neuropodia of chaetiger 1 broken, with six unbroken serrated capillaries with a minute basal spur. Aciculum not seen.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 6.
Eurythoe parvecarunculata
Holotype (ZMA-V.Pol. 0309). (A) Entire body, lateral view, (B) anterior end, dorsal view, (C) aciculae, notopodium of chaetiger 7, (D) serrated capillary chaeta with a long spur, notopodium of chaetiger 7, (E) serrated capillary chaeta with a long spur, notopodium chaetiger 15, (F) furcate chaeta, neuropodium of chaetiger 36, (G) serrated capillary chaeta with a minute basal spur, notopodium of chaetiger 7; (H) serrated capillary chaeta with a long basal spur, notopodium of chaetiger 1; (I) harpoon chaeta, notopodium of chaetiger 7. Scale bars: (A) 0.5 mm, (B) 0.22 mm, (C) 11 mm, (D) 21 mm, (E) 28 mm, (F) 14 mm, (G) 12 mm, (H) 6 mm, (I) 15 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Harpoon chaetae present on notopodia after chaetiger 3. Furcate chaetae absent on notopodia after chaetiger 3.

Notopodia of chaetiger 7 with 16 harpoon chaetae, five serrated capillaries with a minute basal spur and 12 serrated capillaries with a long basal spur. Harpoon chaetae straight, with a pointed tip; with 11 coarse denticles along cutting edge ( Figure 6I ). Blade of serrated capillaries with a long basal spur 563 mm long; spur 50 mm long ( Figure 6D ). Blades of serrated capillaries with a minute basal spur 412 mm long ( Figure 6G ). Aciculae numbering 3, extending beyond notopodial lobe, enlarged distally, with rounded tip ( Figure 6C ). Neuropodia with 13 furcate chaetae and two serrated capillaries with a minute basal spur. Furcate chaeta with a long tine 44 mm long and a short tine 8 mm long. Four aciculae, resembling those on notopodia.

Notopodia of posterior parapodia (chaetiger 36) with 45 harpoon chaetae and 35 serrated capillaries with a minute basal spur. Blade of serrated capillaries 660 mm long. Neuropodia with seven furcate chaetae only; long tine 58 mm long, short tine 7 mm (broken); an undamaged furcate chaeta with long tine 60 mm long and short tine 27 mm long ( Figure 6F ). Three aciculae per ramus.
Anal opening located terminally or slightly dorsally, occupying only one chaetiger. Pygidium with unpaired rounded anal papilla.

bibRefCitation.author: Gravier C
bibRefCitation.refString: Gravier C. 1902. Contribution a l'etude des annelides polychetes de la Mer Rouge. Nouv Arch Mus. 3 (4): 147 - 268.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Amphinome djiboutiensis Gravier 1902 : p.243
–248, Plate IX, Figures 137–139.

paragraph.materialsCitation: Holotype , MNHN TYPE 147 , Red Sea , Djibouti , Gulf of Aden.

subSubSection.paragraph: Holotype complete 90 mm long, 9 mm wide, with 63 chaetigers. Body elongate, almost circular in cross-section, dark brownish, no colour markings ( Figure 7A ).

Branchiae present from chaetiger 3 to end of body, dendritically branched throughout; emerging posterior dorsolateral sides of segments; densely ciliated; with about 38 terminal filaments on chaetiger 4, 80 terminal filaments on chaetiger 7, 95 terminal filaments on chaetiger 31, and 30 terminal filaments on chaetiger 61.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 7.
Amphinome djiboutiensis
Holotype, MNHN TYPE 147. (A) Entire body, lateral view, (B) anterior end, dorsal view, (C) stout simple chaeta with a minute basal spur, notopodium of chaetiger 1, (D) stout simple chaeta, neuropodium of chaetiger 38, (E) serrated capillary chaeta with a long basal spur, notopodium of chaetiger 1, (F) aciculum, notopodium of chaetiger 38, (G) aciculae, neuropodium of chaetiger 38, (H) harpoon chaeta, notopodium of chaetiger 38. Scale bars: (A) 11 mm, (B) 2 mm, (C) 18 mm, (D) 34 mm, (E) 28 mm, (F) 26 mm, (G) 50 mm, (H) 22 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Notopodia of chaetiger 1 with seven aciculae, 24 straight simple chaetae with weak distal spines and 10 capillary chaetae. Neuropodia with seven aciculae, 15 straight simple chaetae with a minute basal spur and nine serrated capillaries with a long basal spur. Spurred straight simple chaeta with blade (from spur to tip) 42.5– 92 mm long and spur 5–12.5 mm long; coarsely serrated on cutting margin of blade ( Figure 7C ); blade of serrated capillaries with a long basal spur 263 mm long; spur 15 mm long ( Figure 7E ); aciculum tapering, with rounded tip.

Notopodia of chaetiger 7 with a number of capillary chaetae, aciculae, straight simple chaetae with distal spines and 25 harpoon chaetae. Straight simple chaetae, with bent, pointed tip; coarse subdistal spines on cutting edge. Harpoon chaetae thin, straight, with weak denticulations on cutting edge. Neuropodia with a number of straight simple chaetae with distal spines, 14 aciculae, and five capillary chaetae.
Anal opening situated on dorsum of last three chaetigers. Pygidium with unpaired midventral anal papilla.
